cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander near the south-west Bay of Campeche through Thursday, then accelerate northward across the central Gulf toward the Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near the Mississippi River delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted for the northern Gulf Coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect only for the coast of Mexico from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central Gulf Coast from the Texas/Louisiana border eastward to Alabama is within the 5-day cone, with highest risk centered on coastal Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Up to strong tropical-storm-force gusts possible late Saturday night through Sunday with a current peak probability of 11% for sustained 34-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Increasing threat of 2–4 ft surge along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent bays as Cristobal approaches the coast Sunday
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain Sunday–Monday with locally higher totals leading to flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Periods of squalls could restrict navigation; river stages already high may experience additional rises from heavy rain and surge backing up the Mississippi River
